intro: Reseda spinescens, commonly known as the spiny reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Reseda spinescens is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
